page.title: 11COMMUNITY SPIRIT IN HAUGHTON
page.content: _______________________________ Haughton is a small close-knit community where everyone knows everyone else and their occupation, and where help is freely given when needed. There are few services in the locality with public transport being very limited. People with cars help by giving lifts to those without transport if they need to keep dental or hospital appointments, to visit friends or go shopping. During the eighties the village school and the chapel have both closed despite protests and campaigns to keep them open. Falling attendance and financial constraints were given as reasons. Both buildings are now houses so two social centres have been lost. The children are bussed daily to schools in larger villages.
